While some codes are used differently, many are used the same.
All the 10 c=
ode references I've found indicate a 10-7 is an out of service.
Can you poi=
nt to a reference that shows a different meaning?

--- On Mon, 5/11/09, Jon=
 <jms480@...> wrote:

From: Jon <jms480@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Dat=
e: Monday, May 11, 2009, 8:17 PM











    
            
            
=


      
      There are general set of 10 codes that recommended and publi=
shed for people listing to emergency services radio bands as a go by.=A0 Ma=
ny departments customize the 10 codes for their department, so from locatio=
n to location the codes don't always mean the same thing.=A0 When multiple =
departments are working together Home Land Security recommends that to elim=
inate possible misunderstandings, 10 codes should not be used.
=A0Regards,
=
Jon in Texas=A0

From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .co=
m
Sent: Monday, May 11, 2009 8:08:33 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - =
interesting tidbit of info











    
      
      
Code 7 is either c=
ode for being out of service (short for 10-7), or a meal break:

http://www=
.radiolab s.com/police- codes.html
http://www.yougetin fo.com/info/ PolCode=
s. html


--- On Sun, 5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com> wrote:

=
From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@
 yahoo.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - i=
nteresting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Sunday, May 10=
, 2009, 9:31 PM








    
      
      Tonight at work I was talking to =
a state trooper, there had been an accident. I asked him if there were any =
deaths (it was very very bad) and he said he didnt know so he got on his ra=
dio and called in and asked them if it was a 7 at the site. They told him n=
egative, and he told me the little boy who was the worst off was still aliv=
e. I asked him why did you ask them if it was a 7. He said code 7, I was as=
king them if they were dead. So if you ever hear anyone call 7 over the rad=
io that means someones dead.
=A0
Just thought I would pass that on. I find =
it interesting since I know alot of us have heard this before when used to =
describe who is speaking rather than a name they say seven.
=A0
Misty




 =
